main

Class SocialNetwork

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.SocialNetwork

  • public class SocialNetwork
extends java.lang.Object
    SocialNetwork class manages a map of users and links associated with them, as well as providing access to creating links and events between users
    Author:
    Adam Gleichsner (amg188@case.edu)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SocialNetwork()
      Class constructor Creates a new network HashMap

      Checks if user is in the system.

      Establishes a link between two users if they exist in the system.
      User getUser(java.lang.String id)
      Retrieve a user from network by scanning each user key for a matching id.
      boolean isActive(java.util.Set<java.lang.String> ids, java.util.Date date)
      Checks to see if the ids are unique and in the system, if they have a link, and if so if it's active

      Tries to grab the user using getUser().
      boolean tearDownLink(java.util.Set<java.lang.String> ids, java.util.Date date, SocialNetworkStatusWrapper status)

      • SocialNetwork

        public SocialNetwork()
        Class constructor Creates a new network HashMap

    • Method Detail

      • addUser

        public boolean addUser(User user)
        Checks if user is in the system. If he isn't, add them.
        Parameters:
        user - - User to add
        Returns:
        boolean - true if added, false otherwise

      • isMember

        public boolean isMember(java.lang.String id)
        Tries to grab the user using getUser(). If the user is returned, then obviously it must be in the map.
        Parameters:
        id - - target user id
        Returns:
        boolean - true if found, false if not

      • getUser

        public User getUser(java.lang.String id)
        Retrieve a user from network by scanning each user key for a matching id.
        Parameters:
        id - - Search target id
        Returns:
        User - user that has a matching id

      • establishLink

        public boolean establishLink(java.util.Set<java.lang.String> ids,
                    java.util.Date date,
                    SocialNetworkStatusWrapper status)
                      throws UninitializedObjectException
        Establishes a link between two users if they exist in the system. If they don't share a link yet, a new link is created and established.
        Parameters:
        ids - - Ids of the two users
        date - - Date to establish on
        status - - Wrapper class to return a status result depending on whether or not actions occurred and if not, why
        Returns:
        boolean - true if established, false if otherwise
        Throws:
        UninitializedObjectException

      • tearDownLink

        public boolean tearDownLink(java.util.Set<java.lang.String> ids,
                   java.util.Date date,
                   SocialNetworkStatusWrapper status)
                     throws UninitializedObjectException
        Tears down a link if it exists and is active. Since we can't tear down a link that hasn't been established yet, no link creation is done here.
        Parameters:
        ids - - ids of users to tear
        date - - date of teardown
        status - TODO
        Returns:
        boolean - true if torn down, false if otherwise
        Throws:
        UninitializedObjectException

      • isActive

        public boolean isActive(java.util.Set<java.lang.String> ids,
               java.util.Date date)
                 throws UninitializedObjectException
        Checks to see if the ids are unique and in the system, if they have a link, and if so if it's active
        Parameters:
        ids - - ids of users
        date - - date to check activity
        Returns:
        boolean - true if active, false if inactive or no link
        Throws:
        UninitializedObjectException
